itemDescription: Scottish recipient of the Victoria Cross (1842-1879)

wikipedia_page.main: James Dundas VC (10 September 1842 – 23 December 1879) was a Scottish recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

link_mentions.page: List of Scottish Victoria Cross recipients

response: Educated at Addiscombe Military Seminary, Trevor was 33 years old, and a major in the Bengal Engineers, Bengal Army during the Bhutan War when the following deed took place on 30 April 1865 at Dewan-Giri, Bhutan for which he was awarded the VC in a joint citation with Lieutenant James Dundas:
* Captain James Dundas, who won the Victoria Cross for his actions in Afghanistan in 1879
James Dundas was a Scottish VC recipient.
James Dundas may also refer to:
* James Dundas, Lord Arniston (1620–1679), Scottish politician and judge

link_mentions.page: List of people educated at Edinburgh Academy

response: He was born on 19 November 1802, the son of James Dundas of Ochtertyre, founder of the major Scottish legal firm Dundas & Wilson, and his wife Elizabeth Graham of Portmore. His siblings included David Dundas (1799–1877), Privy Counsellor, and Ralph James Dundas (1795–1824) and John Dundas (1803–1873), all lawyers. William Dundas (1796–1842) died at Niagara Falls

William John Dundas, FRSE, LLD, WS (1849-1921) was a Scottish lawyer and mathematician. In later life he was a director of the Royal Bank of Scotland.The Bankers, Insurance Managers and Agents Magazine, vol 113 He was the younger brother of James Dundas VC.

His brother was the military hero Captain James Dundas VC. His great nephew and namesake William John Dundas (1923-1965) was one of the three survivors on the sinking of HMS Hood by the Bismarck in 1941.http://www.hmshood.com/crew/biography/wjdundas_bio.htm
